title: You want to win or you want perfection?
review: What made me watch the movie - the castingWhat I liked about the movie - it is what it says. A match between two rival car companies, where Mr. Miles makes his mark only to be forgotten for decadesWho will I recommend the movie to - anyone who'd like to see the art of actingWhat did the movie teach me - not always does a good person win. Sometimes, it doesn't even matter that you win. When your aim is perfection, little things like awards don't mean crap.#OMAAT One Movie At A TimeHere, the word 'movie' refers to both movies and series.

title: Rosebud
review: What made me watch the movie - I stumbled across this title across many curated movie recommendation sites and listsWhat I liked about the movie - the complexity and enormity of a plot. Here is a biography of a behemoth told by a DebutantWho will I recommend the movie to - a serious movie buffWhat did the movie teach me - your entire life could turn to naught. All your life you work for an ideal, and in the end, no one might even recall it or relate to it. Much like 'Rosebud'#OMAAT One Movie At A TimeHere, the word 'movie' refers to both movies and series.

title: Aged like fine wine
review: What made me watch the movie - the stellar cast and the ace directorWhat I liked about the movie - the movie itself is the opposite of the Two Popes. I think I'm borrowing the words of a movie critic when I reiterate that the two popes invisibilized the craft of acting, while this movie made it overt and flamboyant. This movie is a slow burn, and by the time you've seen the movie, you'd have aged significantly - emotionallyWho will I recommend the movie to - a serious series buff. This movie, like Sherlock, is not for everyone.What did the movie teach me - taking pride in one's work#OMAAT One Movie At A TimeHere, the word 'movie' refers to both movies and series.

title: Awestruck again!
review: What made me watch the movie - I found this in a lot of movie recommendation sites/listsWhat I liked about the movie - endearing plot, the depth of dialogues, and the sheer will of the cast and crew to create a trilogy spanning the length and breadth of timeEthan Hawke and Linklater are both known to be pioneers in the craft of film making where time is used as a propWho will I recommend the movie to - someone who'd like to know what it's like to share a lifetime with someoneWhat did the movie teach me - maybe there is such a thing called soul mates#OMAAT One Movie At A TimeHere, the word 'movie' refers to both movies and series.

title: A big fish indeed!

Don't let that thought stop you. Be the big fish.#OMAAT One Movie At A TimeHere, the word 'movie' refers to both movies and series.

title: Tear jerker
